title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: interest fostering open welcoming environment, contributors maintainers pledge making participation project community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, disability, ethnicity, gender identity expression, level experience, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes creating positive environment include: Using welcoming inclusive language respectful differing viewpoints experiences Gracefully accepting constructive criticism Focusing best community Showing empathy towards community members Examples unacceptable behavior participants include: use sexualized language imagery unwelcome sexual attention advances Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical electronic address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Project maintainers responsible clarifying standards acceptable behavior expected take appropriate fair corrective action response instances unacceptable behavior. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, ban temporarily permanently contributor behaviors deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within project spaces public spaces individual representing project community. Examples representing project community include using official project e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event. Representation project may defined clarified project maintainers.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported contacting project team admin@katilingban.io. project team review investigate complaints, respond way deems appropriate circumstances. project team obligated maintain confidentiality regard reporter incident. details specific enforcement policies may posted separately. Project maintainers follow enforce Code Conduct good faith may face temporary permanent repercussions determined members project’s leadership.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 1.4, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/4

title: Contributing
text: contributing repository, please first discuss change wish make via issue, email, method Ernest Guevarra repository making change. Please note code conduct, please follow interactions project.

what: How to make a clean pull request
title: Contributing
text: Create personal fork project Github. Clone fork local machine. remote repo Github called origin. Add original repository remote called upstream. created fork ago sure pull upstream changes local repository. Create new branch work ! Branch development. Implement/fix feature, comment code. Follow code style project, including indentation. Add change documentation needed. Squash commits single commit git’s interactive rebase. Create new branch necessary. title: Open Data Kit (ODK) R API
text: Open Data Kit (ODK) free open-source set tools help organizations author, field, manage mobile data collection solutions. ODK provides ---box solution users : Build data collection form survey; Collect data mobile device send server; Aggregate collected data server extract useful formats. odkr set interface utility tools useR working ODK. package currently two classes functions: 1) data processing tools; , 2) ODK-R interface functions. data processing, currently three functions included can used perform typical data processing tasks associated working ODK-collected datasets renaming variables dataset, expansion responses questions allow one answer merging nested datasets. ODK-R interface, included set functions work via command line interface Java application ODK Briefcase fetching pushing Open Data Kit (ODK) forms contents. can used gather aggregate data mobile client ODK Collect internet connectivity, ODK Aggregate Server set-ODK Aggregate Server preferred. Current production version ODK Briefcase v1.8.0 executable .jar file can downloaded Open Data Kit website. ODK Briefcase version 1.4.4, scriptable command line interface (CLI) Java application available. package provides R interface ODK Briefcase via available CLI pull forms remote ODK Aggregate Server local ODK folder /odk collected mobile clients. package function downloads latest version ODK Briefcase (currently v1.8.0) additional functions use CLI ODK Briefcase perform data extraction data export. package requires Java 8 installed. Java 8 can downloaded .

title: Open Data Kit (ODK) R API
text: ODK-R interface component package requires Java 8 installed computer. known issues using ODK Briefcase Java 9. Java 9 installed, uninstall (Windows; macOS) install Java 8. issues persist even Java 8, may need reconfigure Java. terminal, execute following command: reconfiguring Java still doesn’t solve issue, may need specify JAVA_HOME executing following command terminal:
code: R CMD javareconf sudo R CMD javareconf JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/default

title: Open Data Kit (ODK) R API
text: Install odkr CRAN: Install development version odkr installing devtools installing odkr package via git
code: install.packages("odkr") library(odkr) # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("validmeasures/odkr") library(odkr)

title: Open Data Kit (ODK) R API
text: 1. Rename variables ODK-collected dataset Depending designed structured ODK form, standard naming variables output dataset isn’t always desirable eventual data processing analysis. example, ODK forms groups questions modules sets, ODK append grouping name prefix actual name assigned variable usually separated / .. renameODK() function extracts actual variable name assigned designing form removing prefix grouping labels. can done simply applying renameODK() data.frame follows: 2. Expand multiple answer responses survey questions allow multiple answers provided, expandMultChoice() function recodes multiple columns 0/1 coding number equivalent number choices selected respondents. function can called follows: 3. Merge nested datasets ODK forms repeat argument, resulting dataset splits data repeats. Often, multiple datasets need merged parent dataset (usually data containing common identifiers cluster, household). mergeNestedODK() function merges together datasets using ODK-defined KEY PARENT-KEY variables. function can called follows:
code: renameODK(sampleData1) # Expand the choices in variable ws7 expandMultChoice(answers = renameODK(sampleData2)$ws7) mergeNestedODK(parent = renameODK(sampleData1),                child = renameODK(sampleData2))

title: Open Data Kit (ODK) R API
text: Following ODK interface functions odkr package. However, functions can utilised, local copy ODK Briefcase needs downloaded local copy ODK Briefcase functions integrate wit ODK databases. download latest version ODK Briefcase, get_briefcase() function can utilised follows: download latest version ODK Briefcase Desktop rename odkBriefcase_latest. Specifying destination directory ODK Briefcase required. preferred save ODK Briefcase different filename, following command can issued R: save local copy ODK Briefcase Desktop name odkTool.jar. Downloading ODK Briefcase can done unless want update latest version ODK Briefcase previously downloaded older version. downloaded ODK Briefcase, following functions can utilised integrate ODK databases. 1. Pull forms remote ODK Aggregate Server ODK Aggregate Server already setup receiving form submissions survey, can use odkr pull forms (data) local directory. example, want pull ODK form form id stakeholders remote ODK Aggregate Server (.e., ONA) https://ona.io/validtrial/ local directory ~/Desktop using ODK Aggregate Server account username validtrial password zEF-STN-5ze-qom. pull_remote function odkr can used follows: example, note using previously downloaded ODK Briefcase saved Desktop. target specification can changed directory previously saved ODK Briefcase. operation completed, now able see folder named ODK Briefcase Storage Desktop containing forms instances stakeholders form ODK Aggregate Server. 2. Pull forms local /odk folder extracted ODK Collect ODK Aggregate Server setup plan use ODK Briefcase form aggregator, extract/copy /odk folder mobile client location computer (e.g., ~/Desktop) can apply pull_local function pull forms instances local directory (e.g., ~/Desktop) follows: example, note using previously downloaded ODK Briefcase saved Desktop. target specification can changed directory previously saved ODK Briefcase. operation completed, now able see folder named ODK Briefcase Storage desktop containing forms instances stakeholders form ODK Aggregate Server. 3. Export data ODK Briefcase Storage CSV file pulled forms either remote ODK Aggregate Server local /odk folder now ODK Briefcase Storage one local directories, probably want extract data found forms use purposes e.g., data analysis. export_data function allows extract data local ODK Briefcase Storage (e.g., found ~/Desktop) containing form stakeholders save local directory (e.g., ~/Desktop) .csv file named test.csv follows:
code: get_briefcase(destination = "~/Desktop") get_briefcase(destination = "~/Desktop", briefcase = "odkTool") pull_remote(target = "~Desktop",             id = "stakeholders",             to = "~/Desktop",             from = "https://ona.io/validtrial/"             username = "validtrial",             password = "zEF-STN-5ze-qom") pull_local(target = "~/Desktop",            id = "stakeholders",            to = "~/Desktop",            from = "~/Desktop") export_data(target = "~/Desktop",             id = "stakeholders",             from = "~/Desktop",             to = "~/Desktop",             filename = "test.csv")

title: Open Data Kit (ODK) R API

title: Function to recode a choose-multiple column where multiple answers are recorded in the same element (e.g.
text: answers Character vector given answers (strings containing choices) choices (optional) Character vector choices used (become column). supplied, choices determined answer parameter, splitting given answers empty space (" ") finding unique values. naCode (optional) Single element specifying character code equates NA naQuestion (optional) TRUE/FALSE vector length answers; rows false, columns coded NA

code: expand_choice(   df,   x,   values,   pattern = "",   prefix = x,   labels = values,   sep = "." )

title: Function to expand response to a more than one answer multiple choice question coded as a concatenated string — expand_choice

Default "" concatenated strings separator. prefix Prefix names newly created variables. labels Vector names use columns resulting data.frame. specified, columns named using values. sep Charater separate prefix labels names newly created variables.

title: Export data in CSV format from local ODK Briefcase Storage directory to a specified destination directory and a specified file name — export_data
code: export_data(   target = "",   briefcase = "odkBriefcase_latest",   sd = FALSE,   id = "",   from = "",   to = "",   filename = paste(id, "_data.csv", sep = ""),   start = NULL,   end = NULL,   overwrite = FALSE,   exclude = TRUE,   group.names = TRUE,   split = FALSE,   pem = NULL,   pullBefore = FALSE,   includeGeo = FALSE )

title: Export data in CSV format from local ODK Briefcase Storage directory to a specified destination directory and a specified file name — export_data
text: target Path directory ODK Briefcase .jar file. Directory path match directory path used calling get_briefcase(). ODK Briefcase .jar file downloaded manually https://opendatakit.org, target match directory path .jar file downloaded . briefcase Filename downloaded ODK Briefcase .jar file. Default odkBriefcase_latest match default filename used get_briefcase(). ODK Briefcase .jar file downloaded manually https://opendatakit.org, filename match default filename used Open Data Kit usually "ODK Briefcase vX.Y.Z Production.jar" vX.Y.Z version number sd Logical. TRUE, create ODK Briefcase Storage path specified . Default FALSE. id Form ID form pulled Path source ODK Briefcase Storage extract data. match directory path specified making call pull_remote() pull_local() Destination directory save output data file filename Filename output CSV data; default paste(id, "_data.csv", sep = "") start Include data submission dates (inclusive) start date export CSV. Date format YYYY-MM-DD YYYY/MM/DD end Include data submission dates (inclusive) date export CSV. Date format YYYY-MM-DD> YYYY/MM/DD overwrite Overwrite existing output data destination directory filename; default FALSE exclude Exclude media files export; default TRUE group.names Logical. group names removed column names export? Default TRUE. split Logical. select multiple fields split export? Default FALSE. pem Path pem key using encrypted form. Null default. pullBefore Logical. set true, pull export. Default FALSE. includeGeo Logical. set true, pull geojson. Default FALSE.

title: Export data in CSV format from local ODK Briefcase Storage directory to a specified destination directory and a specified file name — export_data

title: Export data in CSV format from local ODK Briefcase Storage directory to a specified destination directory and a specified file name — export_data
code: # Export data from a specified ODK Briefcase Storage directory to current # working directory with a filename called "test.csv" if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   dirPath <- tempdir()   get_briefcase(destination = dirPath)   export_data(target = dirPath,               from = dirPath,               to = dirPath,               id = "stakeholders",               filename = "test.csv",               overwrite = TRUE) } # }

title: ODK Briefcase R API — odkr
text: ODK Briefcase Java application fetching pushing OpenDataKit (ODK) forms contents. can used gather aggregate data mobile client ODK Collect internet connectivity, ODK Aggregate Server set-ODK Aggregate Server preferred. ODK Briefcase executable .jar file can downloaded OpenDataKit GitHub repo.

title: ODK Briefcase R API — odkr
text: ODK Briefcase version 1.4.4, scriptable command line interface (CLI) Java application available. package provides R interface ODK Briefcase via available CLI pull forms remote ODK Aggregate Server local ODK folder /odk collected mobile clients. package requires Java 8 installed. Java 8 can downloaded .

title: ODK Briefcase R API — odkr
text: Maintainer: Ernest Guevarra ernestgmd@gmail.com (ORCID) [copyright holder] Authors: Laura Bramley [copyright holder] contributors: Jeffrey W. Rozelle jwrozelle@figured.io [contributor]

title: Pull ODK forms from a local ODK folder (/odk) collected from ODK Collect mobile clients — pull_local
code: # Pull forms from a local ODK folder to current working directory if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   dirPath <- tempdir()   get_briefcase(destination = dirPath)   pull_local(target = dirPath,              id = "stakeholders",              from = system.file("odk", package = "odkr"),              to = dirPath) } # }

TRUE, create ODK Briefcase Storage path specified . Default FALSE. id Form ID form pulled Destination directory pulled ODK forms URL remote ODK Aggregate server pull ODK forms data include_incomplete Logical. incomplete forms pulled? Default FALSE max_http_connections Integer value maximum simultaneous HTTP connections allowed. Defaults NULL allow default 8 simultaneous HTTP connections. title: Pull ODK forms from remote ODK Aggregate via ODK Briefcase — pull_remote
code: # Use latest ODK Briefcase and connect to a test   # remote ODK Aggregate server from ONA (https://ona.io); pulled forms to   # be saved in default location at current working directory   if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   dirPath <- tempdir()   get_briefcase(destination = dirPath)   pull_remote(target = dirPath,               id = "stakeholders",               from = "https://ona.io/validtrial",               to = dirPath,               username = "validtrial",               password = "zEF-STN-5ze-qom")   } # }

odkr 0.3.2.9000
text: fifth release odkr (third development release). version, following implemented: updated pull_remote push_data functions match new CLI syntax ODK Briefcase change license MIT GPL3 removed hex logo per feedback ODK branding guidelines general package maintenance (documentation, external site) addressed issues raised users regard package installable; error arising wrong .Rbuildignore specification

title: odkr 0.3.1.9000
text: fourth release odkr (second development release).

title: odkr 0.3.0.9000
text: third release odkr. developmental release. odkr archived CRAN (see previous release). Current plan continue development odkr outside CRAN.

title: odkr 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-06-03 version, implemented changes respond package issues CRAN check results. get_briefcase() function, changed download url ODK Briefcase permanent download url provided developers https://github.com/opendatakit/briefcase. now resolves issue apparent download corrupt jar file. briefcase-related functions now include check runtime Java availability Java version checking minimum Java version Java 8. followed testing script specified CRAN Writing R Extensions manual.

title: odkr 0.1.3
text: CRAN release: 2018-02-09 version, implemented following changes: DESCRIPTION, mention Open Data Kit ODK put single quotes. addition, put single quotes mentions ODK software derivatives ODK Briefcase ODK Aggregate consistent format. DESCRIPTION, mention Java put single quotes consistent format software names. DESCRIPTION, added URL Open Data Kit angle brackets auto-linking various functions, corrected mistake specifying default write/save directory path. Instead, advised, kept empty arguments user need specify placed check statements user forgets input directory paths needed. consequence previous, re-coded examples use tempdir() suggested specify test location arguments needing directory path inputs consequence previous, re-coded tests use new specified syntax default write/save directories.

title: odkr 0.1.2
text: Resolve issue testing specifically test check whether function export_data() produces output test.cscv. Upon checking, logs show indeed test.csv produced way test structured depending build parameters, test doesn’t look test.csv file appropriate location. , re-worked test call function specify clearly output goes worked actual test check correct directory test.csv.

title: odkr 0.1.1
text: Resolve issues download.file() handles downloads Windows platform. previous version, mode argument download file specified. fine Linux macOS downloaded file worked accordingly. Windows, without specifying mode, downloaded file recognised either invalid corrupted hence producing errors noted testing. Now, mode argument set "wb" get_briefcase() function.

title: odkr 0.1.0
